page.title: 01ASHPERTON AND ENVIRONS
page.content: The village of Ashperton is scattered along both sides of a long straight stretch of the A417 following the line of a Roman road. Many cars speed through the village but few stop; it is unusual to see people walking along this busy road. This is a rural community with its origins in the settlement Spertune in the original Domesday Book. It has the remnants of a village green with a war memorial alongside the village hall. Several half-timbered houses and a square towered church are surrounded on all sides by fields of wheat, potatoes, hops, grassland, and woodland. This village has changed little over many years but is now beginning to feel the effect of the movement of townspeople into the country. Some are buying newer houses but more are renovating old cottages.
